alert.note: Alert for Isle of Wight; Surry (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 4:13PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong outflow winds will impact portions of Isle of Wight and eastern Surry Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 411 PM EDT, strong outflow winds from thunderstorms over the Peninsula are moving across the James River and into Surry and Isle of Wight Counties. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...NWS Employee Observed. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Locations impacted include... Smithfield, Surry, Isle Of Wight, Dendron, Rescue, Scotland, Elberon, Rushmere, Pons, Carrollton, Chippokes State Park, Longview, Benns Church, Bethel Church, Ellis Fork, Poolesville, Alliance, Mogarts Beach, Runnymede and Wills Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
